page.title: 12WHITGREAVE A LOCAL VILLAGE.
page.content: Whitgreave,or White grove as it was originally,is approached from the A34 by a twisting lane ,hedge-lined and slightly sunken.The 40 or so houses are mainly along the one road,though a few are along one side of a smaller lane that is at right-angles to it. The older houses and the church are at the top of the slight hill that the road climbs,while the others are scattered along either side of the road.The village has doubled in size this century.The newer houses tend to be at either end of the village. The general appearance is one of quiet,with very little traffic and very few people about.Gardens are well kept,many having trees in them,giving a sheltered picture.The road is lined with hedges or flower-beds.Most houses are brick built,though one whichis timber framed is about 400
